Retrotrons have low values by default, you'll need 2 or 3 of them to decouple a orange tank + rockomax 16 + engine combo. This is so that you don't need a smaller variable for smaller stuff.

The new perfectrons also share the same balance. You'll need 2 to decouple bigger lateral stages, and only one for the small stuff.

Excellent. I was looking for a small pod LES, as I plan to run a safe space program.

Could you make the separation motors on top of the Soyuz tower operational? That would solve "decouple node" issues. Also, Apollo LES had RCS in the nosecone, for some reason hardly anyone remembers about that.

Could you make the separation motors on top of the Soyuz tower operational? That would solve "decouple node" issues. Also, Apollo LES had RCS in the nosecone, for some reason hardly anyone remembers about that.

As far as my understanding goes, there's no way to make the separation motors work without plugins (because it would be like making 2 engines into a single one and the game can't understand what you are trying to do).

On the RCS issue, there weren't any RCS as far as I remember (In fact, RCS were nova's ugly solution to the issue, by making a 2-part escape tower composed of the tower itself and a nosecone with rcs capability)

The "Pitch control motors" were a series of solid motors that fired only when needed (If the abort was during the first seconds of the launch where the rocket is mostly vertical and thrusting up won't get you out of the way).

What it had, that mine does not, is self-deploying canards. I could do the animation part but the canards would have no use so I decided not to include them.

Right, it was the Orion LES that had an active attitude control. Also, the way to make separation motors work is to split the LES into two parts (a 3rd part, possibly radial, would work as a pitch control motor). BobCat did that in his mod, and it works. Also, canards don't do anything useful (not without a plugin), but they do look incredibly cool.
Those LES' look very cool. But do they have room for parachutes? Wait, that doesn't matter, I'm using SDHI, so I can just use the Boost Protective Cover and Sumghai's parachute-dockingports.

Like Wasmic said, perfectrons are engines that separate your stuff once you decouple it. They are not decouplers, they are separatrons. Anyways, something like a "Decoupler-separatron" hybrid could be made. I'll further investigate this.

Those LES' look very cool. But do they have room for parachutes? Wait, that doesn't matter, I'm using SDHI, so I can just use the Boost Protective Cover and Sumghai's parachute-dockingports.

Space inside the LES is something that will be in future versions. It was already suggested.

Right, it was the Orion LES that had an active attitude control. Also, the way to make separation motors work is to split the LES into two parts (a 3rd part, possibly radial, would work as a pitch control motor). BobCat did that in his mod, and it works. Also, canards don't do anything useful (not without a plugin), but they do look incredibly cool.

Personally, I see LES as a way to save on partcount and get a nice -thing- instead of 8 separatrons clipped together joined to a tower of cubic struts and then tethered to a command pod. I'm just aiming for part reduction here, so more complex systems are not something I'll look to in the immediate future. Maybe as a later addition to the L.E.S. Pack. But before all that, I want to finish what I promised (The other LES models, the radial engines, etc).

Once all that is done, I'll keep working with the SRB Pack.

@PDCWolf

Ive tried it and the models are very nice and thrust seems to be realistic but there is a very big realism oversight with your LES. They only work when the command module weight is centered. But real life command modules didnt have their weight centered. They were weighted on one side so that during reentry the bottom of the module would form a lifting surface that could be rotated with RCS to provide upward or downward lift to keep the proper reentry angle.

I weight all my command modules to one side like in real life so i can use FAR and DRE to do lifting reentries like the real apollo CM. But when i try your escape tower with this it just flips around in the air and then rips apart.

Can you fix it?

Also, can you include the sheath on your escape tower that covers the command module?
